     The Winchester Model 1200 was first offered to the public in 1964. It was used by US Marines and US Army soldiers in Vietnam. The recticle is a post with crosshair(similar to the PU scope on the 91/30 sniper) took a picture but it's hard to capture the rectical. it's got a military style almost parkerized finish. Scopes nearly identical to these were used on early m1garand snipers and even some 1903a3 springfields. Looks awesome on vintage rifles.   The optic is crystal clear and adjustable for windage and elevation. The scope body is in near perfect shape. It also comes with a set of period correct weaver rings. They are the thb screw type. XD-S® 4.0” Single Stack

The XD-S® 4.0″ Single Stack turns Springfield Armory®’s single stack XD-S® platform into a mid-sized pistol. The sub-compact frame extends to full-size length when you insert an X-Tension™ magazine, adding capacity and controllability for your time at the range. Use a flush fitting magazine for concealed carry, and you’ll forget it’s there.

Choosing a multi-purpose handgun doesn’t have to be a series of compromises anymore. The .45 ACP is a cartridge that compromises nothing in the power department, and the XD-S® is a concealed carry pistol without compromise. Put an XD-S® 4.0″ Single Stack in your hand today, and you’ll want to shoot it. Put it in your holster, and you’ll find that it’s Noticeably Unnoticeable™.

title: For Trade:  FENDER DELUXE STAGEMASTER V4 NECK THROUGH FLOYD ROSE W/ AMP
postcontent:
Fender Deluxe Stagemaster V4 w/ Peavey TransTube Amp and Hard Case!
$400

For those who know what this is no explanation is necessary, for those who don't read on.......
Don't let the 'squire' Label fool you on this beautiful MINT condition Fender, this was made before Fender started making shitty cheap low end squires and has some super high end features. For those who know about these gems it is a highly collectable piece of the Fender lineage.
These models were discontinued before they started making the cheap $100 squires to tap the beginner market. 

Absolutely MINT condition, featured HH pickup configuration and a locking Floyd Rose Trem System, 24 frets, rosewood fretboard on a Neck through maple neck, reverse headstock, and 3 way selector, in the gorgeous Atlantic Blue Metallic (569) Finish
The reverse headstocks on the Stagemasters allow for completely straight string pull. Another nice feature is the inclusion of a brass bridge sustain block on the licensed Floyd Rose bridge and rear-mounted electronics allowing for a guitar with no pickguard.

Action is great, sound is also amazing, a beautiful guitar all around.
Comes with a Hard Case, and a Peavey Rage 158 TransTube Amp and a fresh new set of #9 Strings

Specs:

Fender Stagemaster V4:
A reverse headstock
A Licensed Floyd Rose Locking Tremolo System w/ brass bridge sustain block
2x Humbucker Pickups
A contoured neck heel (Rounded corner where the neck meets the body)
3 piece Maple Neck Through Body w/ Rosewood Fretboard
A slightly narrower body than earlier models
24 fret necks (Early models had 22 fret necks)
One volume and one tone control
Knife selector switch (3-way or 5-way)

Peavey Rage 158 Transtube Amp:
15 Watts RMS into 4 Ohms
Pre and Post Gain Channel
Transtube technolgy
1/4 Headphone port

title: For Sale/Trade:  1,000 Rounds Golden Tiger 7.62x39mm
postcontent:
WTS/WTT a case of 1,000 rounds of the accurate, consistent, clean, highly sought after Golden Tiger. This ammo sold out across the country almost immediately following the sanctions against Russia last year. According to one of their largest importers, SG Ammo, whether or not we will receive any more is questionable, and the factory may be producing for the Russian Gov't rather than US sales because the sale price is double in Russia vs. the U.S. 

If you own a weapon chambered in 7.62x39mm, you want to have some of this in your emergency stash. The bullets are sealed at the case neck and the primers are sealed as well. The bullets are boat tails and they have an air pocket at the tip that makes them tumble and fragment effectively. This ammo is remarkably accurate our of my SBR. Huge difference between Golden Tiger and Wolf when it comes to consistency and accuracy. Don't take my word for it, do some research and see for yourself.

$350 Face-to-Face in St. Petersburg or Pinellas Park

title: For Sale:  AR 15 Rifle 2 .223/5.56NATO 16" "wylde" chambered barrel 1:8 twist
postcontent:
Pictures 1, 2 are the basic components for sale.

Picture 3 also includes a complete lower receiver build kit, minus your supplied stripped lower receiver. 

Picture number 4 is what it will look like as a complete firearm.

The cost if you purchase the components in pictures 1 and 2 only is $420. The cost if you purchase all the components in picture 3 is $540. If you purchase all the items in picture 3 and would like me to assemble your lower I will charge an additional $15. Picture 4 from me is a total of $555 (with your supplied stripped lower receiver). 

Pictures 1 and 2.......This Carbine has a 16" barrel with a "wylde" chamber which is specially made to accept both .223 and 5.56 rounds and is from Maric Arms, it is made from parkerized steel and has a twist rate of 1:8. The flash suppressor is a 'devastator' from Karri's Arms. The upper receiver is from SAA and is forged from Mil-Spec 7075 T-6 Aluminum and has M4 feedramps. The Bolt Carrier is from SAA, are Mil-Spec, made of phosphate and is chrome lined. The gas key is properly staked. The bolt is phosphate, and both the bolt carrier and bolt are of excellent quality. The handguard is a Yankee Hill Diamond Free Floating spectre length 9.675". The gas block is low profile standard aluminum and the gas tube is carbine length at 9.75". 

Picture 3 is a standard Lower Parts Kit from Aero, but the different grip you will get, instead of the standard BS grip, is pictured. The different trigger guard that you will get is pictured, and is a polymer curved guard for room for a gloved finger, and not the standard BS straight trigger guard.

Picture 4 is how it will look once it is complete and put together. (Picture 4 is for visual purposes only as your pistol grip will be as in picture 3 and your front and rear take down pins will be stock)

This rifle has been test fired to ensure proper functioning.

title: For Sale:  WINCHESTER MODEL 70 375 H&H PRE WAR Rare
postcontent: Winchester Model 70 in 375 H&H, Sn 44097. By serial number this puts the year of manufacture of this rifle in 1941, only 875 Winchester Model 70's were made in this caliber before WW2. This Mdl 70 is one of the RARITIES of Model 70 collecting. Simply put the quality of the rifle is superlative. It feature Super Grade Sling Swivels, a factory red "Winchester" butt pad that is still pliable, express sights and a dark figured Walnut that might have made this rifle a special order? The rifle retains 98%-99% of it's original blued finish, a bright bore and the wood has some storage bruising which is consistent with it's age as all the pictures indicate.

postcontent:
Up for sale/trade is an excellent condition CZ 97B, the big brother to the infamous CZ 75.  It is high gloss blue which makes it even more rare. This gun is DA/SA chambered in 45 ACP and is very accurate. More accurate and more reliable than any of these $2,000 1911's out there. 

This gun is extremely hard to find!  There are NONE in Ohio on armslist, and just a handful in the entire country.  Look around at any online gun store/auction sites.  They are all sold out (for a good reason)!

Gun is in excellent condition with 99% (or more) blueing.  Bore is bright and clean.  Always kept a film of RIG grease on this pistol for preservation.

Comes in original box, with the 2 original 10 round mags, original walnut grips + CZ rubber grips, original cleaning tools and barrel bushing tool.

Feel free to ask any questions.  Asking $725 OBO. Thanks for looking.

The Springfield 1911 Loaded .45 5in Stainless is a variant of the “Loaded” series from Springfield Armory’s 1911 Custom Shop, a line which covers all of the upgrades a shooter could want, including all of the hard to do gunsmith-required upgrades.  

The following is included in the Springfield 1911 Loaded .45 5in Stainless:

Forged frames slides and barrels, precision machined and them fit to exacting standards.  The slides feature front and rear slide serrations and a flared and lowered ejection port as well as a loaded chamber indicator and all the edges are beveled for easier carry. postcontent:
" AK47 /AK74 drill jig , "semi auto to full auto"

""Know your local , state and federal laws!!!! Buyer assumes any and all responsibility at purchase , ( in other words if you do anything against current firearm laws without approval from the government it's on you !!!!) 

Please allow 5 to 10 business days for processing and shipping , order usually arrive sooner than posted delivery times but do to conditions out of our control , weather, holidays, weekends ect , order could take 5 to 10 business days to arrive ! 

These jigs are for shipping only , no local pick up ! 

These jigs last for thousands and thousands of conversations, simple and very easy to use! No machine shop equipment required !!!! Just a DRILL and Dremel ! 

AR15 to M16 select fire 
The fixture is a drilling template made of machined steel that properly places the hole above the selector for the GI auto sear pin. A bolt is used to hold the fixture in place and the top of the fixture is aligned parallel with the top of the receiver to align sear pin hole. There is a washer that is used to allow the fixture to clear the "selector stops" on the receiver. There is still a small amount of milling that has to be done to allow for clearance for the sear in the receiver but that is explained in the fixture instructions and may be done with a mill a dremel or on a drill 

We ship nation wide , free shipping to lower 48 

We also ship internationally ! International buyers , email for shipping charges! 
Email with any questions !

Other Drill Jigs Available are as Follows 

Semi to Full Auto AK-47 - AK74 : $115.00 comes with cnc made pins . 
The fixture is a drilling template made of machined steel that properly places the sear pin hole in the receiver for the auto sear pin. There are machined steel pins that are used to hold the fixture in place on the receiver. There is still a small amount of dremeling that has to be done to the carrier rail to allow for clearance for the trip in the receiver but that is explained in the fixture instructions, and may be done with a dremel. Since the holes are two different sizes on the AK-47 a bushing is provided for the right side hole to guide the bit that is the same size as the bit to eliminate the need to center punch this hole.

M-11/9 semi to M-11/9 SMG: $105
The fixture is a drilling template made of machined steel that properly places the selector switch hole in the receiver for the full auto selector. A bolt is used to hold the fixture in place and the top of the fixture is aligned parallel with the top of the receiver to align selector hole.

H&K (All Types) including H&K Clones ( Cetme, PTR, ect ) : $105
The fixture is a drilling template made of machined steel that properly places the take down pin hole in the semi-auto receiver to allow for the installation of a full auto push pin lower.


Buyers are responsible to know their local or state laws !

The Second Ammendment of the united states constitution !!!!!   the right of the people,  to keep and bear arms,  !!!! ( SHALL NOT BE INFRINGED )!!!!!  Enough said .

title: For Sale:  KelTec PMR30
location: Oconee County Seneca, Greenville, South Carolina
postcontent:
The PMR-30 is a light weight, full size pistol chambered for the flat-shooting .22Magnum cartridge (.22WMR). The PMR-30 operates on a unique hybrid blowback/locked-breech system. This operation system allows for the use of a wide variety of ammunition as it seamlessly adjusts between locked breech and blowback operation, depending on the pressure of the cartridge. It uses a double stack magazine of a new design that holds 30 rounds and fits completely in the grip of the pistol. The trigger is a crisp single action with an over-travel stop. The manual safety is a thumb activated ambidextrous safety lever (up for SAFE, down for FIRE). The slide locks back after the last shot and a manual slide lock lever is also provided. The light, crisp trigger pull and fiber optic sights make the PMR-30 ideal for target shooting and hunting small game.




Slide and barrel are 4140 steel, frame is 7075 aluminum. Grip, slide cover, trigger, mag release, and safety levers are glass reinforced Nylon (Zytel), much like other Kel-Tec Pistols. Magazine is Also Zytel and holds 30 rounds, with round count ports. Other features include: dual opposing extractors for reliability, heel magazine release to aid in magazine retention, dovetailed aluminum front sight, Picatinny accessory rail under the barrel, Urethane recoil buffer, captive coaxial recoil springs. PMR30 disassembles for cleaning by removal of a single pin.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Rare French MAS MLE 1949 - 56 IN 7.5 MM - NICE 49/56, similar to .308
postcontent:
Here is a very seldom seen collectible and functional military rifle. A French MAS MLE 1949-56 rifle in original 7.5 mm.  It includes many of the accessories that most others for sale don't include and are pricey as well as quite hard to come by.  It has the original 'night sight' tube that slides over the end of the barrel, original sling with original cleaning kit and fully functional, adjustable sights as well as the flip up grenade launcher sights.

The predecessor rifle was the French MAS-49; it was formally adopted by the French Army in July 1949. 

An improved version of the MAS-49 was the MAS-49/56; it was introduced in 1957 and incorporated lessons learned from service in Algeria, Indochina, and the Suez Crisis. The rifle was shortened and lightened to improve mobility for mechanized and airborne troops, and a knife bayonet was added. The MAS-49 built-in rifle grenade launcher was replaced by a combination compensator/rifle grenade launcher that fired NATO-standard 22mm rifle grenades. The rifle also incorporates an integral grenade launching sight that is attached to the front sight block and a gas cutoff that prevents gas from entering the gas tube from the gas port when firing grenade launching blank ammunition.

This rifle is chambered in the original 7.5 mm; many were re-chambered at import into .308 and are considered less desirable.  Even though this is a very collectable rifle, it's a very fun weapon to shoot and will surprise you with how modern and well made it is. 

This rifle is in excellent overall condition. Tight action, clean barrel, and nice rifling. The stock in very good condition (see pictures). 

Again, weapon is in original 7.5 X 54 (French) or 7.5 mm, and also has the original barrel length at approximately 20.7".  

3 original 10 round magazines included. 

This is a unique opportunity to own a fairly rare rifle in excellent condition and all the accessories included. 

Here's a little info about this very capable, but often overlooked caliber:

The 7.5x54mm French rifle round was originally adopted for the French infantry to replace the aging 8mm Lebel. The French learned many lessons from World War I, and realized the need to adopt a more modern cartridge. In 1929 the 7.5x54 ammo cartridge was adopted by the French military along with the Mas 36 rifle.

The 7.5 French cartridge served during World War II in various bullet configurations including ball, tracer, and incendiary. The bullet weight varies from 139 grain to 181 grain with velocities generally ranging from 2,700 feet per second to 2,600 feet per second. Although this round is older is design, it does features some impressive ballistics, especially when considering the round is not typically a shoulder bruiser.

The round is capable of being an effective hunting cartridge at intermediate ranges, and is quite capable against medium to medium large North American game. The cartridge is particularly popular with military surplus enthusiasts, but not for the MAS 36 rifle, but for the MAS 49. The Mas 49 is an interesting semi-automatic, post-war rifle. In short, the 7.5mm French cartridge is an excellent cartridge that was an excellent wartime round that often gets overlooked.


Feel free to ask any questions and offer any trades or cash + trade offers.  I own an extensive collection of fine weapons and have worked at a gun shop before so please don't bother me by asking a ridiculous amount in trade for what you have.  I'll only consider quality weapons, no Cobras or the like.

Included in the package are: rifle, 3 original 10 round magazines, original 'night sight' tube and canvas storage bag, 2 original magazine pouches (each hold 2 magazines), original sling with original cleaning kit attached and about 25 rounds of ammo (10 rounds of quality 'FOM' non corrosive + about 15 rounds of Turkish corrosive ammo).  Ammo is available for this rifle and I can offer you my cost for more rounds if desired.

Thank you

title: For Sale:  Walther CCP 9mm 8rd Stainless $465
postcontent: We just received four more Walther CCP's. Two in Black and two in Stainless. Walther (CCP). $465.00 CCP 9mm 3.54" 8rd Description: The CCP (Concealed Carry Pistol) in 9mm Luger has an ideal combination of style, ergonomics, size, shape, accuracy, and ability to conceal comfortably. The Walther Soft Coil ™ gas-delayed blowback technology works to make the CCP an excellent concealed carry firearm. The CCP’s Soft Coil™ gas-delayed blowback system uses gas pressure from the ignited cartridge by directing it through a small port in the barrel in front of the chamber to slow down and delay the rearward motion of the slide. This is accomplished by means of a piston contained inside of a cylinder located under the barrel that opposes the rearward motion of the slide until the gas pressure has declined after the bullet has left the barrel. This allows the slide to end its rearward motion, opening the breech, and ejecting the empty cartridge case. With an overall length of just 6.41 inches, the Walther CCP is a sleek solution to concealed carry protection. The model’s barrel length is 3.54 inches and its width is only 1.18 inches making it easily carried in a purse or inside-the-pant holster. The CCP comes in Cerakote® black and provides all the features that have become a signature of Walther’s line of pistols. It has a smooth 5.5 pound trigger pull, interchangeable front sight with white dot, adjustable rear sight, and reversible magazine release for left- or right-handed operation. This single-stack semi-automatic has a magazine capacity of 8 rounds. For maximum safety, the CCP comes equipped with a slim manual thumb safety and one internal safety that acts as a firing pin block. As with all Walther firearms, the CCP has an ergonomic grip with a unique non-slip surface. Other key attributes of the firearm include an easy access slide stop, loaded chamber indicator for added safety, and serrations (front, rear and trigger guard) for additional safety and control of its easily manipulated slide. Specifications: - Operation: Gas Delayed Blowback - Caliber: 9mm - Finish Color: Cerakote® Black - Barrel Length: 3.54" - Trigger Pull: SA 5.5 lbs - Trigger Travel: 0.27" - Capacity: 8 rounds - Overall Length: 6.41" - Height: 5.12" - Width: 1.18" - Weight(mag empty): 1.39 lbs If you have any questions please let us know. We accept all major credit cards. We charge 6.75% sales tax (Hoke County) for NC residents. We are a licensed FFL dealer and SOT holder (Class III/ NFA) All Federal and state laws apply. title: For Sale:  Custom Built AR 15
location: 10 miles South of Ft. Wayne, Fort Wayne, Indiana
postcontent: This rifle was built for distance shooting.  SAA Lower and CMMG Lower Parts Kit with A2 Stock for increased accuracy.  The SAA lower is one of the best I have used.  All of my guns have them.  My Class III dealer tells me they are run on the same line as Spikes.  My experience is they are definitely on par with Spike and much superior to AR57 and a few others I have tried.  All the AR's in my vault are now SAA.  They are the best bang for the buck. It is a great product with less cost. This one has a 5# CMMG trigger pull.  A2 stock has storage compartment for field gear.  Free floated Yankee Hill Machining tube for more increased accuracy.  Ability to add rails on free float hand rail.  I have kept the rails to a minimum to lower the weight.  There is a rail on the bottom for a bipod, laser, or light, and full rails across the flat top.  I have a scope and flip up iron sights on it.  These are not included in the price, but for another $150, I will include the scope and flip up sights.  I paid over $200 for them.  Upper is SAA with custom 20" Wilson Combat Bull Barrel that is 1 in 9" twist.  This barrel was originally a 26" varmint barrel that was re-cut and re-crowned by a Class III dealer.  I have added a custom Don't Tread On Me Charging handle and Dust cover.  There is also a Yankee Hill flash hider that is wicked cool looking. I built this gun for me to shoot anything threatening my homestead.  The only reason I am selling it is I have 2 other 5.56 guns and have added a .308.  My other 5.56 rifles are lighter but with a shorter range.  The .308 will take care of what this AR was meant to cover and then some.  This AR is easily a 500 yd + gun.
